James Alvey

I am a PhD student in Theoretical Particle Physics and Comsology at King's College London. I am interested in how to model the early Universe and use data from Cosmology to constrain new physics.

My work so far covers Big Bang Nucleosynthesis, Graph Networks in the context of the Cosmic Microwave Background, the Direct Detection of Light Dark Matter, and Neutrino Astrophysics.

Contact me
